headline: U.S. strikes on Iran will likely boost defense stocks. Here’s what will keep the cash flowing even after the conflict ends.
summary: A massive backlog of maintenance and software contracts will ensure recurring revenue.

headline: What Defense Stocks Stand to Gain—and Lose—From the U.S. Attacks on Iran
summary: The U.S. attack on Iran promises to increase already-high geopolitical tensions, which have prompted countries around the world to raise spending on national defense.  The attacks followed a weekslong military buildup in the region and came after an American strike on Iran’s nuclear facilities in June.  Through Friday trading, the  was up 35% since the June Iran strike.

headline: Iran Escalation Shock Triggers Risk-Off Move To USD And Gold, Oil, Defense And Aerospace Win

headline: Iran live updates: U.S. and Israel launch strikes, Trump dubs attack 'Operation Epic Fury'
summary: President Trump said in a video the U.S. and Israel launched "major combat operations" attacking Iran. Iran retaliated with strikes across the Middle East.

headline: Lockheed Martin Balances Defense Contracts And Quantum Research As Valuation Steadies
summary: Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT) secured a foreign military sale to supply C-130J training devices and upgrades to the Royal Australian Air Force. The company also announced a research initiative with quantum computing firm Xanadu focused on Quantum Machine Learning. Both developments highlight fresh activity in global defense partnerships and advanced computing for potential national security use cases. For you as an investor, these updates relate to two core parts of Lockheed Martin’s story:...

headline: Explosions heard across the Middle East as Iran retaliates against U.S. attacks; flights disrupted
summary: CNBC's team in the United Arab Emirates confirmed hearing a number of loud explosions in both the UAE's capital city of Abu Dhabi and Dubai.

headline: Tehran strikes back at Gulf states after U.S.-Israel launch massive attack on Iran
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump said Iran has continued to pursue nuclear weapons despite ongoing negotiations to end its program.
